very strange or foolish: She’s the craziest person I’ve ever met. [ + to infinitive ] You’re crazy to rent the place without seeing it first.
Crazy can mean mentally ill.
Crazy can also mean behaving in a strange way esp. because of stress, as if you are mentally ill: The constant whine of the machine nearly drove (= made) me crazy. I think she’ll go (= become) crazy if she doesn’t take a vacation soon. crazily adverb [ not gradable ] us
